course_description: Intensive study of Spanish with oral, written and reading practice. Selected readings and multimedia materials for practical insights into the customs and cultural contexts of the contemporary Spanish-speaking world.

course_description: Introduction to Ancient American and Iberian civilizations and early Latin America through critical study of European colonialism and contestatory colonial agencies of Africans, Creoles, Native Americans, Mestizos and Europeans.
prerequisites: Notes: given in English. This course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

course_description: Formation of Iberian cultures to modern times, in the contexts of social, political, religious, intellectual, literary, and artistic themes and developments. Topics include multicultural and cross-cultural influences, maritime explorations, globalization, diasporic identities, traditions, and innovations, as a reflection of Iberian society in different historical periods. Use of print and visual media texts.
prerequisites: Notes: given in English. This course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

course_description: Comprehensive grammar review emphasizing language structure, style and critical thinking through print and visual media texts.
prerequisites: Notes: This course has an experiential learning component . may be offered as a blended format. This course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term. Experiential opportunities and Community Service Learning component for interested students.

course_description: Iberian and Latin American film representations of nationality, ethnicity, gender, religion, exile/migration and politics. Emphasis on national and transnational cultural and socio-political contexts and on the study of national/regional cinema movements. Delivered online.
prerequisites: Notes: Spanish and Portuguese language films with English subtitles. Given in English. This course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

course_description: Interdisciplinary approach to the study of Indigenous peoples, languages, cultures and narrative traditions of Portuguese and Spanish-speaking Americas, focusing on the significance of storytelling, orality's role, and other narrative forms in the transmission of language and culture in the construction of collective memory. Effects of globalization, digital media, and technology on these languages and cultures.
prerequisites: Notes: Consult the Instructor regarding permission to reg ister. This course has an experiential learning component . given in English. No knowledge of Spanish and/or Portuguese required. This course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

course_description: Historiography, collective memory versus official history, relation of past to future, oral history and its transcription into testimonial literature.
prerequisites: Notes: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

course_description: Contesting identity categories resulting from exchanges and interactions of Christians and Muslims in the early modern Mediterranean world, through the study of historical and fictional primary sources.
prerequisites: Crosslisting: also offered as HIST 3Q92 and MARS 3Q92

course_description: Research project carried out under the supervision of a faculty adviser.
prerequisites: Crosslisting: also offered as HIST 3Q92 and MARS 3Q92

course_description: Multidisciplinary approach to the study of the island imaginary. Concepts of insular narrative spaces and the Other, language, literature and cultural translatability, oral storytelling tradition, and emerging and emergent narrative identities.
prerequisites: Prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): one SPAN credit numbered 2(alpha)00 or above.
